review: As I said, It does what it says it does but unfortunately people judge it by what they want it to do.First off, for the price nothing comes close to delivering what this does. It is now up to 10+ supported apps, but to be clear this device streams the content from the internet (not from your phone), so if your looking for screen mirroring from your phone its not there (atleast not yet). What buyers should also be aware of is that some of the apps it streams from require a subscription to work.Setup was quick, plug it in download the app and basicly hit next a couple of times. Launch your supporting app from your phone and then just hit the chromecast button.So far I've tested it with Pandora, Netflix, You tube and Google Music all of which worked flawlessly. But there was a snag with tabcasting, I was under the impression that you can open the tab from any chrome browser but it appears you can do so from the Android Chrome version.
author: Calvin

review: I got the Chromecast because it offers HDMI Streaming of media between an android device and my HDMI TV but, I quickly found out that only specific applications will allow you to stream.  The Amazon Kindle Fire HD which is based on a proprietary Android OS, does not allow you to stream videos from your PRIME account over the chromecast device.I would hope that Amazon considers jumping on the support band wagon so that this device is also supported on their applications.Other applications that were downloaded to the Kindle though alternative means do work such as the YouTube app, and HBO GO app work well.

review: ok so I have owned Boxee, Roku, XBMC , apple TV , heck i even have a raspberry Pi with a media center on it. But chromecast has met all expectation. It is small, easy to carry and I have been playing my friends video through plex anywhere I want. It doesnt have the baggage of creating another system for you to look at, which is awesome.browser cast can definitely improve. I am looking for a way to display the complete device screen ( let it be phone or tablet or computer), that will kill all competition whatsoever

review: They need more apps, but they'll come. It works great for Hulu, Netflix, etc. I just wish there was a player that played from a network drive and casted. Android's default player casts fine but doesn't stream from a network source. Once that's possible (likely through another player that uses Chromecast that some other developer will need to build, I don't think Google will), then this thing will be a big time win and replacement for HTPCs.
